intro: Greenea adangensis, commonly known as the Adangensis greenea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a glossy surface. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Greenea adangensis is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
